page.title: 01BOWERCHALKE PARISH
page.content: The area covers the southeast part of the village of BOWERCHALKE (Population: 109) and 66% of its Parish (Total population 296). Northeast is larger Broadchalke, 2 miles away - a separate Parish and competitive. Southwards are Dorset and Hampshire borders with separate Local Government Services & access to a Main Road. WOODMINTON is a hamlet on the Northwest side with little individual identity now. The main area is FARMLAND. DOWNS cover the undulating scarp face of MARLEYCOMBE & KNOWLE HILLS, rising sharply to about 675ft. Their unique quality is safeguarded by designation as sites of Special Scientific Interest. Vernditch Chase is mainly deciduous woodland managed by the Forestry Commission. There are many Bridleways & Footpaths.
